snippet: Law enforcement agencies across the country have placed a new emphasis on training and equipping officers to treat serious wounds by reviving the use of tourniquets.
abstract: Law enforcement agencies across country, responding to increase in mass shootings and to new guidelines from federal government, are training and equipping officers to treat serious wounds by reviving use of tourniquets; tourniquets were phased out after World War II because of concerns about prolonged loss of circulation but have returned as transportation times to trauma centers have become faster.
lead_paragraph: Law enforcement agencies across the country have placed a new emphasis on training and equipping officers to treat serious wounds by reviving the use of tourniquets.

headline.main: Reviving a Life Saver, the Tourniquet
